title: This community is really sucking the fun out of the game
body:
Everyone is being so toxic everywhere no matter what. You can be in an aram(a casual game mode meant for fun) and have people flame you for building SLIGHTLY off meta, or making a minor mistake, all while the person flaming you is 1/15. Every time anyone dies at all on the map, expect everyone to cap their ping limit mia pinging the person's body. Don't think you can ever try to ask your teammates to do anything(IE: "can we please play round the infernal coming up?" or "I can't afford to build grievous wounds, can someone else?") or you'll get told to uninstall, kill yourself, or be called various slurs.

It's not that these people are "hurting my feelings",  it's that I don't queue up to babysit for immature 12 year olds or 20 year olds acting like 9 year olds and have to deal with their annoying crap for the entire game. If you mute them and don't give them the attention they want, they'll start trolling you by doing things like going out of their way to set you behind(Following you around taking jg camps if you're a jungler, smiting cannons and trying to take cs if you're a laner, inting, etc). 

This stuff has always been in the game, but it's happening with such a frequency now that it's hard to even enjoy the game. Maybe it's a negativity bias, but it feels like everyday I have at least a game ruined by this kind of stuff, and I don't queue up for many games anymore, so that's really saying something.

People need to stop letting words affect and control them. If someone is flaming you, you can either take it as something positive or simply ignore/mute. Players in high elo don't let a fucking chat box affect their gameplay, and they don't use it as an excuse either.

I believe it's a vocal minority complaining about flame. Because if flame ruined games that much then League would've been declining by now. Thankfully a majority of people I've played with know how to use the mute button and don't get on a mental breakdown.

Focus on the game, not your feelings.

I mute people who are annoying or just laugh at them, but even at that they almost always still have negative effects on the game. Your teammates will stand still for hours responding to them, plus the person who was flaming will most likely never group and either soft int or afk in a side lane the rest of the game and not try to win.
"or just laugh at them". thats not a good mindset my friend. focus on yourself and ways to improve your game at that point. that way its easier to get something out of the game.
Except I get literally nothing out of somebody telling me to "stop focusing the tanks trash ADC" as i'm playing Ashe.
thats wrong. you get input from someone on your team. "stop focusing the tanks trash ADC" take it from the important parts. turn it into "please ignore the tanks". its all what you take way from it.
Except that advice is flat out wrong since i'd just get murdered by the diving garen if I did that

not exactly. there are many ways to utilize flash/ dash to move forward to your team. that comes with game knowledge.   theres alot of things you can do to avoid garen . if you vayne you can flash behind him roll farther and E him really far away and make it a 5v4 for a few seconds even more if it stuns him. also you with holding information from me doesnt make you smart so hold the attitude sir.

I've had many times when teammates just let you die on purpose even though they could have helped, just because you picked off meta but are actually playing well while they are doing terrible but think they are fine since they played the traditional and community acceptable champ for that role. How do I know it was intentionally letting me die? They type in all chat telling the enemy to kill my champ and that they won't stop them. Then when you die, the teammate types to the enemy in all chat "lol xD" afterwards. All just because you played a champ that isn't normally for that role or you built items unusual to the norm.

Point I am making is that muting does help, but it's not really full proof on stopping toxic behavior. Toxic players can be smart and not use chat feaure and still be exhibit toxic behavior through gameplay but since they didn't chat, they most likely get little to no punishment

Intentionally stealing resources from a laner puts them in a worse position? People don't respect how you want to play when you don't respect how they want to play? Wow, shocking! You definitely didn't deserve everything that came to you.

I think you are missing the point. Point is that muting does not solve anything, and toxic behavior can come through both gameplay and not just chat alone. But yet, chat is a big punishment but toxic behavior gameplay wise is punished very softly if not at all. So yes, who gives a damn about respecting what people want when someone can just troll you or throw games anyway and they don't even get punished for it. 

What is the report system gonna do if I buy 3 frozen hearts? It seems trollish and terrible, but it still doesn't look like im throwing. It could just be im new, and i am trying to stack armor up. How would they know if I was intentionally doing it despite knowing it sucks, or if i didn't know and im new? They dont. I could cost the game to my teammates, but hey I don't get in trouble for buying 3 frozen hearts. You wanna get more technical? I could buy a frozen heart, iceborn gauntlet, manamune as soraka. Guess what? You can't get in trouble for making such a bad build decision. I could do it intentionally and make it hard for teams to win but not get in trouble. I could easily just build normal but then in lane attack once every 5 seconds only so when a all in fight happens we lose because im only attacking every 5 second interval while my adc is dead already. The report system does nothing to gameplay behavior. So again, who gives a gromp about caring and respecting other players decisions so they can respect yours if somebody can get away with what I just explained?

Communities are directly effected by a games quality, so it's not really hard to figure out why more and more people are getting into arguments, raging in and out of matches more and more as time goes on and more worthless patches devoid of any healthy changes come through.

Theres always the mute button Zardo, plus you can choose to queue up with buddies exclusively. We all hate toxic players, oftentimes I dont mute them cause I may need to listen if they make a call but there is nothing we can do other than reporting them.

I read other comments here saying that "We can just tough it out" essentially, and that might not be a viable option for all of us. However we should not conform to any minority, if someone demands banning a player because they got their feelings hurt, League would die in the next 20 seconds. But that doesnt negate that people are hurting from all the toxic players. 

My only real response is either mute them, play with friends only, or take a break for a week or two. Play Planetside 2 and die a hundred times to a sniper you can never find.

The best way to combat Toxic players is to mute first and report later.
